page.title: 01COUNTRYSIDE AROUND TILE HILL
page.content: About 3/4 of the land enclosed in the grid reference 04240276 is farmland, mainly grazing. A busy railway line crosses the middle of this area, east to west, passing through two small stations, Tile hill and Berkswell. Down the eastern side of the area it is mainly residential with Tile Hill Village being in the middle of this part. In the south western corner is the edge of Balsall Common which is also residential. There are three schools included - one a co-educational comprehensive (Heart of England), one a single sex comprehensive (Tile Hill Wood Girls) and a small primary school (Leigh Church of England). One large engineering works has reduced in size in recent years and another disused warehouse is now a Sports Centre for the Disabled.
